SEARCH
Package filesystem

Class FileCheckUtils

java.lang.Object
filesystem.FileCheckUtils
public class FileCheckUtils extends Object
This class contains utilities for the following file checks: 1. File (or folder) exists 2. Element is directory / Element is a file 3. File is readable / writable / executable / hidden 4. File is regular file 5. File is symlink Other non-boolean utilities include: 1. File owner and permissions Null-checks and subchecks are also included (E.g. checkDir(file) first looks, if a file exists and then checks, if it is a directory.)

    getPermissions(File file)
    Returns the specified file or folder permissions of the current user in the POSIX-Format: dash is no permission, r = read permission, w = write permission, x = execution permission Examples: File "C:\Users\User1\test.txt" has rwxrwxr-x (Windows) File "/etc/someapp/someapp.conf" has r-xr-xr-x (Linux) (First three user, Second three group, Third three others)

    • getPermissions

      public static String getPermissions(File file)
      Returns the specified file or folder permissions of the current user in the POSIX-Format: dash is no permission, r = read permission, w = write permission, x = execution permission Examples: File "C:\Users\User1\test.txt" has rwxrwxr-x (Windows) File "/etc/someapp/someapp.conf" has r-xr-xr-x (Linux) (First three user, Second three group, Third three others)
      Parameters:
      file - Input file to start with
      Returns:
      File permissions in POSIX-Format

    • prefetchFile

      public static File prefetchFile(File startFile)
      Converts "startFile" into the standardized file format. (Examples: "./tmp/sometextfile.txt" -> "/home/user/Downloads/tmp/sometextfile.txt" | "~/Desktop" -> "/home/user/Desktop/" | "/etc/semicolons/data" -> "/etc/semicolons/data/")
      Parameters:
      startFile -
      Returns:
      The same file with the standardized format, if "startFile" is valid; null otherwise.
